column4: I'm trying to understand how to use samba in ubuntu to mount my university account onto my computer at home. It's very easy in OS-X, but I don't understand how to do it in ubuntu. how do you use samba on the client-end?
or send me somewhere to learn?
It's all GUI in Gnome too. You choose 'Places -> Connect to Server...' and then set it up.
yeah i tried that, but like i just said to robertj, i don't know all the information I apparently need to make it work... so i need to learn what all those parts mean
Ah ok. Is there any chance whatoever thats amba is not yet installed?
no samba is installed.
'smbclient -U username -L hostname'
No slashes needed there
i tried that already and it gave me that error i mentioned above. then others have been saying to use slashes... i'm trying their suggestions now
Traditionally you need the slashes in smbmount, but not in smbclient.
smbmount would need //hostname/sharename
i'm trying without slashes again, but capitalizing the -U
no, that's the right IP. mine times out too, so probably it's not using samba or is firewalled. (it better be for connections from the net as a whole)
i can connect to it from anywhere, even from home when I connect with my ibook... so there must be some kind of authentication
In OSX, do you connect to it as smb://hostname/ .. ?
no, it just asks for the server name, but then it says "connecting to afp://blah blah"
afp is *appleshare*, not samba.
ahh. frack me then huh. haha
There may or may not be appletalk support in Ubuntu.
That box seems to run FTP though, try that.
The appletalk software for Linux is 'netatalk', but I'm pretty sure that only runs as server, not as client.
i could try ftp from the places menu, but again i don't know what to put in all the fields so it hasn't been able to work yet.
You only need FTP (with login), Server (hostname) and User name (login)
